title: Olenus (trilobite)
text:
Olenus is a genus of <a href="Upper%20Cambrian">Upper Cambrian</a> <a href="ptychopariida">ptychopariid</a> <a href="trilobite">trilobite</a>.
Distribution.
"Olenus" can be found in the <a href="British%20Isles">British Isles</a>, <a href="India">India</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>, <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>, <a href="Newfoundland%20%28island%29">Newfoundland</a>, <a href="Texas">Texas</a>, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>, and <a href="Australia">Australia</a>.
Ecology.
Fossils of "Olenus" are commonly found in dark <a href="mudstone">mudstone</a>s, which were deposited on the seafloor in environments with low oxygen levels. The very wide side lobes (or pleurae) are thought to have shielded extended <a href="gills">gills</a>, which would have helped the animal absorb the maximum amount of oxygen possible in such an environment. Evidence also suggests that "Olenus" and its relatives may have developed a <a href="symbiosis">symbiotic</a> relationship with <a href="sulfate-reducing%20bacteria">sulfate-reducing bacteria</a>, either by feeding on them or by absorbing nutrients directly from them.
Description.
Size: Up to 1.5 in (4 cm) long. It had up to 15 thoracic segments, with a narrow axis and wide pleurae.
